bioghist.p: William Hogarth (1697-1764) was a major English painter, printmaker, pictorial satirist, social critic and editorial cartoonist. Thomas Cook (1744-1818) was an engraver, and a student of Simon François Ravenet (1706-1774), a distinguished French engraver of the period.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of engravings made by Thomas Cook after William Hogarth, including prints of The Rake's Progress, A Harlot's Progress, Marriage à-la-mode, Industry and Idleness, Hudibras, and The Four Stages of Cruelty. Cook's copies of Hogarth's prints are re-engravings from the original plates, and are carefully kept to the same size. Prints from A Harlot's Progress are hand-colored.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
